sentence.idiomatic: My older sister is always drinking hot water because she feels hot water can soothe the throat.
I always see you coming here to dance.
Recently Xiao Wang is always hearing strange noises.
On cold days, drinking more hot water makes you feel warm.
Shanghai is very warm in spring.
Beijing's winters are very cold, but it's warm indoors because there is central heating.
Xiao Zhang likes eating Chinese food, especially spicy food.
Shanghai's shops close early, especially in the winter.
I had a great time in China, especially when I was in Shanghai.
Besides drinking water, are there any other ways to soothe the throat?
Only Xiao Li wants to go to Beijing; the other co-workers want to go to Shanghai.
I don't like red hats. Are there any other colors?
I heard Mrs. Wang went to the United States last month. Is it true?
I heard the manager said Xiao Li resigned yesterday.
Many people have heard this unfortunate news.
I think that learning Chinese is very useful.
Is this waste paper still usable? No.
Mr. Li decided to buy a computer because everyone says they're useful.
The doctor said that drinking more water is very good for the throat.
Exercising more in the winter is good for the body.
Deceiving us will not do you any good whatsoever.
I heard that eating more vegetables can lose weight. Why don't we try it?
Xiao Li really likes that white dress. She wants to try it on.
The Chinese exam is very difficult, but Xiao Wang decided to give it a try.
I always see you drinking hot water. Do you have any particular reason for this?
Drinking hot water makes me feel warm. Especially in the winter, I drink hot water every day.
Are there any other benefits?
I heard from a doctor of Chinese medicine that drinking hot water can soothe the throat.
Is that so? Do you think it’s useful?
I think it’s very useful. Every time when my throat isn’t comfortable, drinking hot water makes it feel much better.
I’ll also try it, then.
